intro: Solanum hibernum, commonly known as the Irish nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to western Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, followed by berries that mature to a dark blue or black color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Solanum hibernum is part of the nightshade family, which includes both edible and toxic species.
